oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Decatur G. Chapin, a white officer of the 55th United States Colored Troops
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This letter is from Decatur G. Chapin, a white officer of the 55th United States Colored Troops, to his brother in California. By late January 1865, he leaves the USCT and becomes Colonel of the 1st TN Freedmen, Enrolled Militia, a home guard militia organized by the state of Tenn. He writes of his positions and thoughts on African American soldiers and of his brother's efforts at mining in the west. According to donor, Chapin is originally from Milan, Mich. and lived in Galena, Ill. after the war.
